How is your family and your dog?

I think I forgot to tell you that I will come and visit you in five weeks!
I can't wait.
So I heard that you hvae to work on a presentation about unsual school projects worldwide.
Two days ago I found a perfect example for you in a newspaper.
Two years ago there was a huge chess proecjt in a germanGerman country called Bremen.
The project was called Schach macht schlau, that means something like chess makes you clever.
Pupils from primary schools had chess lessons once a week for a year.
2400 children took part in this project.
72 percent of the teachers said that their students enjoyed playing chess and 23 percent of them said that a couple of students started playing chess outside of the school in their freetime.
A third of the teachers also said that playing chess helped their students to focus on things and it was good for their social skills.
This project was not the only one we had in Germany.
At a school in Hamburg chess is a normal subject.
Instead of music or art the pupils have one lesson of chess.
They have been doing this for more thenthan ten yeras and the schools' headmaster said that chess is good for students' communication.
The outcome of another project was that also younger people can beat older ones and with a couple of rule changes also good players can loose to bad players.
So all in all I can say that according to the projects chess is good for students at a young age.
I hope I could helpedhelp you with your presentation and hopefully one of your slides is about the germanGerman chess project in Bremen and its outcome.
We will see each other in five weeks!
Have a nice week and say hi to your parents from me.
